name: Create Meeting Minutes from Telegram Messages with GPT-5 to Airtable Slack Gmail
description:
# How it works?

![baptistefortautomatisationairtable.png](fileId:2146)

Send a message or a voice note on Telegram right after the meeting.  

n8n transcribes (**if it‚Äôs a voice note**) and sends the text to GPT.  

GPT generates a structured and professional meeting minutes report.  

The report is automatically stored in Airtable.  

Your team is **instantly notified** in Slack.  

A formal email is sent via Gmail to the right recipients.  

üëâ **Works for all types of meetings**: client calls, team syncs, project updates‚Ä¶ whether you type a message or send a quick voice memo.  

---

# ‚úÖ Requirements

Before running this workflow, you‚Äôll need:  

- A **Telegram account** with a bot configured (to send your messages/voice notes)  
- An **OpenAI API key** (for GPT and voice transcription)  
- An **Airtable account** with a base containing these fields:  
  - Email  
  - Subject  
  - Report  
- A **Slack account** with the target channel for notifications  
- A **Gmail account** connected to n8n (OAuth2)  

# üîß Step-by-step setup

![baptistefortautomatisationagentia.png](fileId:2147)

## Step 1 ‚Äì Telegram Trigger
- **Node**: Telegram Trigger  
- **Updates**: `message`  
üëâ Captures every message or voice note sent to the bot.  

---

## Step 2 ‚Äì Detect text or voice
- **Node**: Code (‚ÄúMessage or Voice ?‚Äù)  
- **Expected output**:  
  - `{ type: "text", content }` if message  
  - `{ type: "voice", file_id }` if voice note  
üëâ Routes the workflow based on the input type.  

---

## Step 3 ‚Äì IF Condition
- **Condition**: `{{$json.type}} == voice`  
üëâ Directs to the transcription branch if it‚Äôs a voice note.  

---

# Voice Branch üé§  

## Step 4 ‚Äì Download the voice file
- **Node**: Telegram ‚Üí Voice note  
- **Parameter**: `fileId = {{$json.file_id}}`  

## Step 5 ‚Äì Wait
- **Node**: Wait (2‚Äì3s)  
üëâ Lets Telegram prepare the file.  

## Step 6 ‚Äì Voice note download
- **Node**: Telegram (file download)  
üëâ Retrieves the audio file.  

## Step 7 ‚Äì Transcribe to text
- **Node**: OpenAI (Transcription)  
- **Resource**: `audio`  
- **Operation**: `transcribe`  
üëâ Converts the voice note into plain text.  

## Step 8 ‚Äì Short wait
üëâ Ensures continuity before sending to GPT.  

---

# Text Branch ‚úçÔ∏è  

## Step 9 ‚Äì Normalize
- **Node**: Code (‚ÄúContent‚Äù)  
- **Return**: `{ text: $json.content }`  
üëâ Standardizes the text as if it were already a transcription.  

---

## Step 10 ‚Äì Detect email
- **Node**: Code (‚ÄúDomain or Email detection‚Äù)  
üëâ Extracts the target email (or builds a fallback `contact@gmail.com`).  

---

## Step 11 ‚Äì Generate meeting minutes
- **Node**: Agent (‚ÄúGenerate Meeting Message‚Äù)  
- **Prompt**: specialized for ‚Äúmeeting minutes‚Äù  
- **Model**: GPT-4.1-mini  
- **Output**: `{ email, subject, body }`  
üëâ GPT creates a clean and structured meeting report.  

---

## Step 12 ‚Äì Enforce clean JSON

- **Node**: Output Parser Structured  
- **JSON Example**:  
json {"email": "address@gmail.com","subject":"Subject","body":Email"}

üëâ Ensures the output is always valid JSON.


## Step 13 ‚Äì Cleanup / Airtable mapping

- **Node**: Code  
- **Return**: `{ Email, subject, Report }`  
üëâ Prepares the correct fields aligned with your Airtable table.  

---

## Step 14 ‚Äì Store in Airtable

![baptistefortautomatisationleads.png](fileId:2148)

- **Node**: Airtable (Create Record)  
- **Mapping**:  
  - Email = `{{$json.Email}}`  
  - subject = `{{$json.subject}}`  
  - Report = `{{$json.Report}}`  
üëâ Archives each meeting report in your Airtable base.  

---

## Step 15 ‚Äì Notify in Slack
- **Node**: Slack (Send Message)  
- **Channel**: your team channel  
- **Message**:  {{$json.fields.subject}}{{$json.fields.Report}}

## Step 16 ‚Äì Send the email
- **Node**: Gmail (Send Email)  
- **sendTo**: `{{$('Create a record').item.json.fields.Email}}`  
- **subject**: `{{$('Create a record').item.json.fields.subject}}`  
- **message**: `{{$('Create a record').item.json.fields.Report}}`

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.

data.details: The Code node allows you to execute JavaScript in your workflow.

workflow.name: Automatic meeting records sent from Telegram to Airtable, Slack and Gmail

nodes.name: Transcription of voice notes to text

parameters.text:
==You are an assistant specialized in writing **meeting minutes to be sent by email**. From the text provided below (coming from a voice note or message): {{ $json.input.text }} **Goals:** 1) **Detect the recipient's email address** in the text (or a similar form like "send to firstname.lastname"). - If the address is incomplete, complete it with `@gmail.com`. - If no address is found, use `contact@gmail.com`. 2) **Understand the meeting context** and extract structured elements: - **Title/Topic** (project, client, subject) - **Date** (if missing, use today‚Äôs date in Europe/Paris timezone) - **Participants** (names or roles if mentioned) - **Decisions made** - **Action items** (with owners + deadlines if available) - **Next steps** - **Risks / blockers** (if present) - **Open questions / follow-ups** (if present) 3) **Generate a clear and informative email subject**, for example: - "Meeting Minutes ‚Äî {Topic} ‚Äî {Date}" - "Summary {Project/Client} ‚Äî {Date}" 4) **Write the email body in HTML**, professional and easy to read: - Greeting - Context reminder (date, topic, participants) - Sections with bold titles: Decisions, Action Items (with owners & deadlines), Next Steps, Risks/Blockers, Open Questions/Follow-up - Conclusion + invitation to reply if corrections are needed - Signature with "Best regards," (do not sign with a specific name) **Output constraints:** - No spelling or grammar mistakes. - Always return the result in the **strict JSON format below**, without any text around it: ```json { "email": "address@gmail.com", "subject": "Email subject", "body": "

Email body in HTML

" } {{ $json.input.text }}

parameters.content: ## Message sent to Telegram as voice note or text?

## Generate meeting minutes
- **Node**: Agent (‚ÄúGenerate Meeting Message‚Äù)  
- **Prompt**: specialized for ‚Äúmeeting minutes‚Äù  
- **Model**: GPT-4.1-mini  
- **Output**: `{ email, subject, body }`  
üëâ GPT creates a clean and structured meeting report.

## Enforce clean JSON

- **Node**: Output Parser Structured  
- **JSON Example**:  
json {"email": "address@gmail.com","subject":"Subject","body":Email"}

üëâ Ensures the output is always valid JSON.

## Cleanup / Airtable mapping
- **Node**: Code  
- **Return**: `{ Email, subject, Report }`  
üëâ Prepares the correct fields aligned with your Airtable table.

## Store in Airtable
- **Node**: Airtable (Create Record)  
- **Mapping**:  
  - Email = `{{$json.Email}}`  
  - subject = `{{$json.subject}}`  
  - Report = `{{$json.Report}}`  
üëâ Archives each meeting report in your Airtable base.

## Notify in Slack
- **Node**: Slack (Send Message)  
- **Channel**: your team channel  
- **Message**:  {{$json.fields.subject}}{{$json.fields.Report}}

## Send the email
- **Node**: Gmail (Send Email)  
- **sendTo**: `{{$('Create a record').item.json.fields.Email}}`  
- **subject**: `{{$('Create a record').item.json.fields.subject}}`  
- **message**: `{{$('Create a record').item.json.fields.Report}}`  
üëâ Sends the complete meeting minutes to the recipients.

main.node: Transcription of voice notes to text
